1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Shorthand functions.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Shorthand
6 ( (&),
7   (++),
8   (<$$>),
9   int, integer,
10   nothing,
11 ) where
12
13import Prelude hiding ((++))
14import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Type as O
15
16infixr 0 &
17
18-- | Pairing operator.
19--
20--   >>> "a" & "b"
21--   ("a", "b")
22--
23--   >>> "a" & "b" & "c"
24--   ("a", ("b", "c"))
25--
26{-# INLINE (&) #-}
27(&) :: a -> b -> (a, b)
28a & b = (a, b)
29
30infixr 6 ++
31
32-- | Associative operator of monoid,
33--   same as 'mappend' or infix '<>'.
34{-# INLINE (++) #-}
35(++) :: (Monoid a) => a -> a -> a
36(++) = mappend
37
38infixl 4 <$$>
39
40-- | Double fmap.
41(<$$>) :: (Functor f, Functor g) => (a -> b) -> f (g a) -> f (g b)
42f <$$> x = fmap f <$> x
43
44-- | 'Int' shorthand.
45--
46--   >>> int 12
47--   12
48--
49--   This is same as:
50--
51--   >>> 12 :: Int
52--   12
53--
54{-# INLINE int #-}
55int :: O.Map Int
56int = id
57
58-- | 'Integer' shorthand.
59--
60--   >>> integer 12
61--   12
62--
63--   This is same as:
64--
65--   >>> 12 :: Integer
66--   12
67--
68{-# INLINE integer #-}
69integer :: O.Map Integer
70integer = id
71
72-- | Function which always returns 'Nothing'.
73--
74--   >>> nothing True :: Maybe String
75--   Nothing
76--
77nothing :: a -> Maybe b
78nothing _ = Nothing
